Main

Class prover

  • java.lang.Object
    • Main.prover

  • public class prover
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains the main method. It is responsible to get a command from user and parse and dispatch the command appropriately.
    Author:
    Hamoon

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        if the command line argument is not empty, we treat args[0] as a filename. if this is the case, we read from the file and load its commands before we submit control to user. if the the address is not a valid address or the file does not exist, we print an appropriate error message and submit control to the user. if the file contains the exit command we terminate the program.
        Parameters:
        args -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • run

        public static boolean readBuffer(java.io.BufferedReader in,
                 boolean console)
        Takes a BufferedReader and reads from it until we hit end of file or exit command.
        Parameters:
        in -
        console - = true if in = System.in
        Returns:

      • loadCommand

        public static boolean loadCommand(java.lang.String s)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        load x.p; loads commands from the file x.p. The file can contain any command except for load x.p; The user don't get a warning if the x.p contains load x.p but the program might end up in an infinite loop. Note that the file can contain load y.p; whenever y != x and y exist.
        Parameters:
        s -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
